# sc-utils

Simple generic utilities (type check, common math functions, etc.)

## Install

```
npm install --save @ircam/sc-utils
```

## API

<!-- api -->
<!-- Generated by documentation.js. Update this documentation by updating the source code. -->

## atodb

Convert a linear gain into dB

*Alias:* `linearToDecibel`

### Parameters

*   `val` **[number][25]** Value to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { atodb } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
atodb(0);
// > 1
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## dbtoa

Convert a dB into linear gain

*Alias:* `decibelToLinear`

### Parameters

*   `val` **[number][25]** Value to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { dbtoa } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
dbtoa(0);
// > 1
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## decibelToLinear

Convert a dB into linear gain (i.e. gain)

*Alias:* `dbtoa`

### Parameters

*   `val` **[number][25]** Value to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { decibelToLinear } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
decibelToLinear(0);
// > 1
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## decibelToPower

Convert a dB into power gain

### Parameters

*   `val` **[number][25]** Value to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { decibelToPower } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
decibelToPower(0);
// > 1
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## delay

Wait for a given number of milliseconds.

See also `sleep`

### Parameters

*   `ms` **[Number][25]** Number of milliseconds to wait

### Examples

```javascript
import { delay } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
// wait for 1 second
await delay(1000);
```

Returns **[Promise][26]**&#x20;

## exponentialScale

Create an exponential scale function.

### Parameters

*   `inputStart` **[number][25]** Start value of input range
*   `inputEnd` **[number][25]** End value of input range
*   `outputStart` **[number][25]** Start value of output range
*   `outputEnd` **[number][25]** End value of output range
*   `base` **[number][25]** Base value for exponential scaling (optional, default `2`)
*   `clip` **[boolean][27]** Clip output to output range (optional, default `false`)

### Examples

```javascript
const { exponentialScale } = utils;
const midiToFreq = exponentialScale(69, 81, 440, 880);
midiToFreq(57);
// > 220
```

## ftom

Convert a frequency in Hz to a MIDI note

### Parameters

*   `freq` **[number][25]** Frequency to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { ftom } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
const freq = ftom(440);
// > 69
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## getTime

Provide a unified clock in seconds accross platforms, with an origin defined by
the start of the process.

### Examples

```javascript
import { getTime } from '@ircam/sc-utils';

setInterval(() => {
  const now = getTime();
  // ...
}, 1000)
```

## hertzToNormalised

Convert a frequency in Hertz to a normalised one in \[0, 1].

Normalised frequency of 1 is half the sample-rate (Nyquist frequency).

### Parameters

*   `frequencyHertz` **[number][25]** Frequency in Hertz to convert
*   `sampleRate` **[number][25]** Twice the Nyquist frequency (optional, default `{}`)

    *   `sampleRate.sampleRate`   (optional, default `2`)

### Examples

```javascript
import { hertzToNormalised } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
hertzToNormalised(12000, {sampleRate: 48000});
// > 0.5
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## idGenerator

Create a iterator of incrementing ids

### Examples

```javascript
import { idGenerator } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
const generator = idGenerator();
const id = generator.next().value
```

Returns **Iterator**&#x20;

## isBrowser

Check if the platform is a browser or a node process

### Examples

```javascript
import { isBrowser } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
isBrowser();
// > true|false
```

Returns **[boolean][27]**&#x20;

## isFunction

Check if the value is a function

### Parameters

*   `val` **any** Value to check

### Examples

```javascript
import { isFunction } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
isFunction(() => {});
// > true
```

Returns **[boolean][27]**&#x20;

## isNumber

Check if the value is a number, including Infinity.
If you want to excluse Infinity, check the native Number.isFinite function

### Parameters

*   `val` **any** Value to check

### Examples

```javascript
import { isNumber } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
isNumber(42);
// > true
```

Returns **[boolean][27]**&#x20;

## isPlainObject

Check if the value is a Plain Old Javascript Object (POJO)

### Parameters

*   `val` **any** Value to check

### Examples

```javascript
import { isPlainObject } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
isPlainObject({ a: 1 });
// > true
```

Returns **[boolean][27]**&#x20;

## isString

Check if the value is a string

### Parameters

*   `val` **any** Value to check

### Examples

```javascript
import { isString } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
isString('test');
// > true
```

Returns **[boolean][27]**&#x20;

## isTypedArray

Check if the value is a TypedArray

### Parameters

*   `val` **any** Value to check

### Examples

```javascript
import { isTypedArray } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
isTypedArray(new Float32Array([1, 2, 3]));
// > true
```

Returns **[boolean][27]**&#x20;

## isURL

Check if the value is a valid URL

### Parameters

*   `url` &#x20;
*   `val` **any** Value to check

### Examples

```javascript
import { isURL } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
isURL('http://sub.my-site.org/abcd?test=123');
// > true
```

Returns **[boolean][27]**&#x20;

## linearScale

Create a linear scale function.

### Parameters

*   `inputStart` **[number][25]** Start value of input range
*   `inputEnd` **[number][25]** End value of input range
*   `outputStart` **[number][25]** Start value of output range
*   `outputEnd` **[number][25]** End value of output range
*   `clip` **[boolean][27]** Clip output to output range (optional, default `false`)

### Examples

```javascript
import { scale } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
const myScale = scale(0, 1, 50, 100);
myScale(0.5);
// > 75
```

Returns **[Function][28]**&#x20;

## linearToDecibel

Convert a linear gain into dB

*Alias:* `atodb`

### Parameters

*   `val` **[number][25]** Value to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { decibelToPower } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
decibelToPower(0);
// > 1
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## logarithmicScale

Create a logarithmic scale function.

### Parameters

*   `inputStart` **[number][25]** Start value of input range
*   `inputEnd` **[number][25]** End value of input range
*   `outputStart` **[number][25]** Start value of output range
*   `outputEnd` **[number][25]** End value of output range
*   `base` **[number][25]** Base value for exponential scaling (optional, default `2`)
*   `clip` **[boolean][27]** Clip output to output range (optional, default `false`)

### Examples

```javascript
const { exponentialScale } = utils;
const freqToMidi = exponentialScale(69, 81, 440, 880);
freqToMidi(220);
// > 57
```

## mtof

Convert a MIDI note to frequency

### Parameters

*   `midiNote` **[number][25]** MIDI Note to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { mtof } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
const freq = mtof(69);
// > 440
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## normalisedToHertz

Convert a normalised frequency, in \[0, 1], to a frequency in Hertz.

Normalised frequency of 1 is half the sample-rate (Nyquist frequency).

### Parameters

*   `frequencyNormalised` **[number][25]** Normalised frequency to convert
*   `sampleRate` **[number][25]** Twice the Nyquist frequency (optional, default `{}`)

    *   `sampleRate.sampleRate`   (optional, default `2`)

### Examples

```javascript
import { normalisedToHertz } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
normalisedToHertz(0.5, {sampleRate: 48000});
// > 12000
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## powerToDecibel

Convert a linear gain into dB

### Parameters

*   `val` **[number][25]** Value to convert

### Examples

```javascript
import { decibelToPower } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
decibelToPower(0);
// > 1
```

Returns **[number][25]**&#x20;

## sleep

Wait for a given number of seconds.

See also `delay`

### Parameters

*   `sec` **[Number][25]** Number of seconds to wait

### Examples

```javascript
import { sleep } from '@ircam/sc-utils';
// wait for 1 second
await sleep(1);
```

Returns **[Promise][26]**&#x20;
